meanings.definition: Add color to (a black-and-white movie or photograph) digitally.
meanings.sent1: The artist was colorizing the old movie to make it more vibrant.
meanings.sent2: She spent hours colorizing the vintage photographs to bring them to life.
meanings.sent3: The computer program had a funny glitch while colorizing the film, turning everything purple!
meanings.sent4: Her imagination was like a magical brush, colorizing the world around her with every stroke.
meanings.sent5: The process of colorizing the images made them look like they belonged in a dream.

meanings.definition: Give color to (something that is monochrome or lacking in color).
meanings.sent1: The artist was colorizing the dull painting with bright hues.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys colorizing his sketches to make them more appealing.
meanings.sent3: The children had a blast colorizing their black-and-white coloring book.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to colorize the room, filling it with joy.
meanings.sent5: The flowers in the garden were colorized by the morning sun, creating a beautiful scene.
